result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William A Stone

records.addlTxt:
(8:44 AM cases 22CM71, 22CF221 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant William A Stone in court. Attorney David W. Field in court for William A Stone.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
State moves to amend 22CM71 Count 1 to an ordinance violation of county theft.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CM71 Amended Count 1: Ordinance violation of County Theft.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Amended Count 1.

Court orders sentence for the defendant to pay court costs and any remaining charges including case 22CF221 are dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on June 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

(Cases 22CF221, 22CM71 are called at 11:12 AM) Defendant William A Stone in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for William A Stone.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges findings in Dr. Minter's report and stipulates to the findings. State moves Exhibit #1 (dr. Minter's report). No objection. Court receives Exhibit #1 and orders the exhibit sealed. 
Based on the stipulation by counsel- Court finds the Defendant is competent to proceed. 
Plea Hearing: 06/01/2022 at 8:45 AM.
The original document was titled: Exhibit #1- Dr. Report- SEALED
The original history event date is: 05-18-2022
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on May 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:44 AM cases called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William A Stone in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for William A Stone. 
Defense asks court to find probable cause based on the complaint and asks for a competency evaluation. Court finds probable cause in both files and orders competency evaluation in both files to be scheduled in Branch 4.

Conditions:
Not to initiate contact with T.X.

(11:07 AM case called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant William A Stone appeared in court. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared in court for William A Stone.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on March 28, 2022 at 3:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Not to initiate contact with T.X.
